title: No Handling for Videos with Non-English Transcripts
description: MEDIUM: Only attempts English transcripts, no fallback. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #22.

title: Add npm scripts to package.json
description: CRITICAL: No build, dev, test, type-check scripts defined. Blocks testing and development workflow. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #1.

title: Update AGENTS.md to clarify beads workflow for planning vs build modes
description: Update AGENTS.md to make it clear that the workflow is as follows - when in planning mode you must use beads to create the issues found as instructed by the user. when in build mode then you must use beads as part of the implementation of the issues

title: Session: Implement semantic versioning with conventional commits and GitHub Actions
description: Complete implementation of automated semantic versioning using semantic-release, conventional commits, and GitHub Actions workflow. Includes beads integration for tracking breaking changes and version bumps.

title: Inconsistent Error Handling Pattern
description: MEDIUM: Different error handling strategies across files. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #18.

title: Remove deprecated TypeScript agent files
description: Delete .opencode/agent/youtube-processor.ts and .opencode/agent/transcript-summarizer.ts after confirming markdown agents are functional. Clean up any TypeScript references in build/tooling.

title: Add 'Conventional Commit Guidelines' section to AGENTS.md
description:
Add comprehensive new section to AGENTS.md after 'Code Style Guidelines' including:
- Commit message format (type, scope, subject, body, footer)
- Commit types table (feat, fix, perf, refactor, docs, test, chore, ci)
- Scope examples (processor, obsidian, api, config, deps)
- Breaking changes documentation (BREAKING CHANGE footer and ! suffix)
- Linking to beads issues (Closes yt-XX, Relates to yt-XX)
- Complete workflow example: beads issue → commit → release → close issue
- Version bump rules table
- Common mistakes to avoid
- Reference links to Conventional Commits and Semantic Versioning specs

File: AGENTS.md
Line position: After 'Code Style Guidelines' section (line 249)

title: No Handling for Very Long Transcripts
description: MEDIUM: 300-word summary cap might be inadequate. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #23.

title: Create .github/workflows/release.yml GitHub Actions workflow
description:
Create automated release workflow that:
- Triggers on push to main branch
- Fetches full git history (fetch-depth: 0)
- Sets up Node.js LTS
- Installs dependencies
- Runs semantic-release with GITHUB_TOKEN
- Creates git tags (v1.2.3 format)
- Creates GitHub releases with release notes
- Commits CHANGELOG.md updates

File: .github/workflows/release.yml
References: AGENTS.md #Phase 2

title: File Path Validation Missing

title: Install semantic-release and required plugins as dev dependencies
description:
Add 8 npm dev dependencies for semantic versioning:
- semantic-release
- @semantic-release/commit-analyzer
- @semantic-release/release-notes-generator
- @semantic-release/changelog
- @semantic-release/git
- @semantic-release/github
- @commitlint/cli
- @commitlint/config-conventional

Run: npm install --save-dev <packages>
Files: package.json, package-lock.json

title: Session: File codebase review issues and implement critical fixes
description: Track filing the 31 issues from CODEBASE_REVIEW.md and implementing the critical ones

title: Add null/undefined checks in summarizer
description: IMPORTANT: String operations without defensive checks can crash on edge cases. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #9.

title: No Logging or Debugging Support
description: MEDIUM: No logging mechanism for troubleshooting. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #30.

title: Test semantic-release with dry-run to verify setup
description:
Verify semantic-release configuration is correct:

Command: npx semantic-release --dry-run

Validates:
- .releaserc.json syntax and configuration
- Can analyze commits since last tag
- Determines next version correctly
- Generates release notes properly
- Does NOT create tags or commit (dry-run mode)

Expected output:
- Next version number
- Release notes preview
- List of changes that would be released
- No actual changes to repo

Depends on: yt-processor-8zk (release config must exist)

title: TypeScript Build Output Not in .gitignore
description: MEDIUM: .gitignore is minimal and doesn't include TypeScript output. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #15.

title: Create .env.example template file
description: Create .env.example with YOUTUBE_API_KEY=your_api_key_here and DEBUG=yt-processor to help developers quickly set up.

title: Convert transcript-summarizer agent to markdown subagent
description: Create .opencode/agent/transcript-summarizer.md as subagent with YAML frontmatter (mode: subagent, temperature: 0.1, strict validation). Focus on intelligent transcript summarization with multiple summary style support. Read-only tool access.

title: Session: Convert TypeScript agents to markdown format following OpenCode standards
description: Refactor youtube-processor and transcript-summarizer agents from TypeScript to markdown format per OpenCode documentation standards

title: Create .releaserc.json with semantic-release configuration
description:
Create configuration file for semantic-release with:
- Branch configuration (main only)
- Commit analyzer plugin (feat/fix/perf/breaking)
- Release notes generator (angular preset)
- Changelog plugin
- Git plugin (commits CHANGELOG.md + package.json)
- GitHub plugin (creates releases and tags)

Note: NO npm publish plugin (not a JS package)
References: AGENTS.md #Task 1.2

title: Create .commitlintrc.json for conventional commit validation

Create commitlint configuration with:

- Header length limits (72 chars)
- Subject and body requirements

References: AGENTS.md #Task 1.2

title: Convert youtube-processor agent to markdown primary agent
description: Create .opencode/agent/youtube-processor.md as primary agent with proper YAML frontmatter (mode: primary, temperature: 0.1, strict error handling). Agent coordinates with transcript-summarizer subagent. Handles file writes to user-specified paths or prints to screen.

title: Update youtube-processor.md: Declare webfetch tool and document env requirements
description: 1) Add webfetch: true to tools list (line 5-12). 2) Add 'Environment Setup Requirements' section before Processing Steps. 3) Update Fetch Video Data step to clarify flow (tool fail → check error type → block on missing key, continue on no transcript). 4) Expand error handling section.

title: Session: Run tests and fix failing tests

description: youtube-processor agent must validate YOUTUBE_API_KEY environment variable at startup and block execution if missing. Add clear setup instructions in error messages. Declare webfetch as fallback tool. Add env var check to test-agents.js. Create .env.example template.

title: Session: Update installation instructions for global and project agent setup
Fix @opencode-ai/plugin module resolution

title: Test youtube-processor workflow end-to-end
description: 1) Test with missing YOUTUBE_API_KEY - verify blocking error with setup instructions. 2) Test with valid API key - verify normal workflow. 3) Test webfetch fallback if tool fails.

title: Add runtime parameter validation
description: IMPORTANT: Optional parameters not validated when provided. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #6.

title: Create first production release with semantic-release
description:
Execute first automated release to generate CHANGELOG.md:

Option A (Recommended - via GitHub Actions):
1. Make conventional commit: 'feat: initialize semantic versioning'
2. Push to main branch
3. GitHub Actions automatically runs release workflow
4. Creates version tag (vX.Y.Z)
5. Creates GitHub release with notes

Option B (Manual local):
- Run: npx semantic-release

Expected results:
- CHANGELOG.md created with all commits since last tag
- package.json version updated
- Git tag created (e.g., v1.2.0)
- GitHub release created with release notes
- Beads issues referenced in commits appear in notes

Depends on: yt-processor-1hc, yt-processor-8zk, yt-processor-7mn

title: Update CONTRIBUTING.md with conventional commits and release process
description:
Add new section 'Release and Versioning' to CONTRIBUTING.md including:
- Explanation of semantic versioning automation
- How version bumps are determined (feat → minor, fix → patch, breaking → major)
- Required conventional commit format with examples
- Automated release process workflow (commit → push → Actions → release)
- Breaking changes documentation
- How to view release history (GitHub releases, git tags, CHANGELOG.md)
- Release notes composition

File: CONTRIBUTING.md
Position: New section after existing content

title: Configure main branch protection rules in GitHub
description:
Update GitHub repository settings:
1. Go to Settings → Branches → Branch protection rules
2. Edit existing 'main' protection rule (or create new)
3. Enable requirements:
   - Require pull request before merging
   - Require status checks to pass before merging
   - Add required check: 'release' workflow
   - Include administrators (enforce on all users)

Result: Prevents any commits merging to main unless release workflow passes

Manual steps required in GitHub UI
Depends on: yt-processor-1hc (workflow must exist first)

title: Type Casting Without Validation
description: MEDIUM: Using 'as' without runtime validation for API responses. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #20.

title: Zod Dependency in tsconfig but Not in package.json
description: MEDIUM: tsconfig mentions Zod in output but package.json doesn't declare it. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #21.

title: Verify semantic versioning setup and document completion
description:
Final verification and documentation:

Verification checklist:
- .releaserc.json exists in root ✓
- .commitlintrc.json exists in root ✓
- .github/workflows/release.yml exists ✓
- package.json includes semantic-release dev dependency ✓
- AGENTS.md has Conventional Commit Guidelines section ✓
- AGENTS.md Step 8 updated with commit requirements ✓
- CONTRIBUTING.md has Release and Versioning section ✓
- Main branch protection rules configured ✓
- Dry-run succeeds: npx semantic-release --dry-run ✓
- First release created successfully ✓

Documentation:
- All 12 implementation tasks completed
- CHANGELOG.md auto-generated and tracked
- Beads issues linked to releases
- Agent workflow documented for future releases

Depends on: All previous issues (1-11)

title: Session: Implement remaining ready issues
No Handling for Special Characters in Video Titles
description: MEDIUM: Doesn't handle Unicode characters, control characters. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #25.

title: Incomplete Error Message Documentation
description: MEDIUM: Error handling section lists errors but no troubleshooting steps. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #13.

description: MEDIUM: User-provided strings used without sanitization. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #29.

title: README Example with Non-Working Video ID
description: LOW: Examples use Rick Astley URL that may not work. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #27.

title: Version Inconsistency
description: LOW: Package version 0.1.0 suggests early development but docs are comprehensive. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #28.

title: Update installation instructions for agents and tools
description: Update README.md to clarify how users can install custom agents and tools by copying .opencode/ directory to either ~/.config/opencode/ (global) or ./.opencode (project-local). Agents cannot be installed via npm install - they must be manually placed in correct locations. Instructions should explain merging with existing directories and reference AGENT_USAGE.md for examples.

title: Update youtube-transcript.ts: Add mandatory YOUTUBE_API_KEY validation
description: Add validation at start of execute() method. If YOUTUBE_API_KEY missing, throw blocking error with setup instructions (link to README). Error message format: [YOUTUBE_API_KEY_MISSING]. Include exact command: export YOUTUBE_API_KEY=...

title: Session: Implement next batch of ready issues
Test and validate markdown agent functionality
description: Run npm test, verify both agents are discoverable, test youtube-processor file output and console output paths, test transcript-summarizer with various input styles. Ensure all existing functionality preserved.

title: Overly Simplistic Transcript Summarization
description: MEDIUM: Summary algorithm is too basic, keyword matching unreliable. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #19.

title: Update test-agents.js: Block execution if YOUTUBE_API_KEY missing
description: Replace warning with blocking check. If YOUTUBE_API_KEY not set: print error message with setup command and README link, exit with code 1.

title: Add debug logging to fetch operations
description: IMPORTANT: Silent failures in transcript retrieval make troubleshooting difficult. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #5.

title: Improve URL extraction patterns
description: IMPORTANT: Regex assumes exactly 11-character video IDs. Doesn't handle all URL variations. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #8.

title: Missing API Key Documentation
description: MEDIUM: Setup section references YOUTUBE_API_KEY but doesn't explain quota limits, costs, monitoring. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #10.

title: Protect JSON.parse calls with try-catch
description: CRITICAL: 4 unprotected JSON.parse calls can crash on malformed data. Locations: youtube-processor.ts (150, 161), transcript-summarizer.ts (101, 121). See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #2.

title: Code Duplication
description: MEDIUM: sanitizeTitle() function defined in two places. See CODEBASE_REVIEW.md Issue #17.
